It would be great if Mojang added a command to do this.

Example: /placedistance 10

That sounds so cool!
Blindness would work too.

I wish it would work in the way that you couldn't put it out with water. Or maybe it would keep burning until you are at one health. Also, it would be really neat if the burning animation on the players screen and enveloping the player would become the same blue color as the rest of the fire.

The thing is that, in fact, this fire seems more weak in destructive power, however stronger in damage. That has to be fixed first.

It seems that blue fire does not propagate in wood planks, or inflammable blocks.

However it deals more damage than regular fire.

I think that for your idea to work, either the damage must be lowered, or the destructiveness potentialized.

In fact, blue fire is dimmer than regular fire.

I'll give it a vote for making sense, but not only does the compass works just fine in the hot bar, but you can also make a locator map out of it, which does fit in the offhand, which is a much better navigational tool.
Especially for traveling in elytra with the rockets in the main hand.
Diamond shield could be built by placing diamonds in a plus formation and then adding iron ingots in the corners.

Here are my suggestions for tiers;

The original: the good ol' wooden shield.

The copper shield: to go along with the recently anounced copper equipment, if Mojang hasent implemented it already. crafted with a regular shield and copper ingot in the smithing table. no further upgrades. takes 1/2 damage

The iron shield: crafted with a regular shield and iron ingot in the smithing table. takes 1/4 damage

The diamond plated shield: crafted with an iron shield and diamond in the smithing table. takes 1/8 damage.

The netherite shield: crafted with a diamond plated shield and netherite ingot in the smithing table. takes 1/16 damage. fireproof like the rest of the netherite gear set.

Yes a change to blindness needs to change. Trick is amping up will need to reduce visibility in stages and give a viable survival option if it is ever implemented.  I'd propose amp 0 be 12 squares reduced visibility, amp 1 be like the current 4 squares, amp 3 be 1, amp 4 total blindness.

Yes, I would want to use Blindness as a kind of "forced fog" as because we can't yet force one (You can usually disable it with Optifine and also it depends on your Chunk Render Distance which makes it not very constant) so, since we have a range of 0-255 (or 0-127 since 128+ or something breaks effects) maybe that would indicate your range of vision? Like, amplifier 0 would be all the blocks in maybe 128 blocks, and amplifier 127 would be 1 block or no vision at all (like the Blindness + Night Vision glitch, but this time its intentional). It's just my thought of this idea instead of using just 5 amplifiers we could use the entire range we're allowed for.

In the new update, it seems like being in powdered snow will make the player have a fog effect like blindness but white and ice surrounds the screen. It would also be nice if that could be used in mapmaking as an effect e.g:"/effect @s hypothermia 10 1" and if you could amplify the strength of this as well as blindness. I feel like this and amplifying blindness is something they might add if they are making this new effect. I think they way it works should also be as the higher the "strength" value is, the further you can see as it will probably be much easier than making it go closer at a higher strength.
Just an idea tho.
I think that Minecraft is a sandbox game where you should be able to access all "abilities" no matter what.

This was not exactly my idea, but seems similar.

 

Here's the thing.

 

Minecraft is a one-night game.

Not because you can play it or finish it in that amount of time, no, but because the only dangerous moment is that first night where you don't have enough resources to survive and end up on the top of a tree, destroying any passage to your "shelter" and hoping there are no skeletons near.

 

After 2 days of (punching trees) working you will die only if you want to.

 

I'm not against the progress the group of Mojang did, I appreciate their effort really much, problem is they made SO many ways to obtain SO many things that made life TOO EASY.

 

Once you start (without any helping chest) you need to find a bunch of trees (they are really rare, so this takes a few hours) and with only 1 average tree of 4 logs you have 16 pieces of wood, let's say we take just 3 logs.

 

With this you could actually build a workbench, wooden pickaxe, get some cobblestone and get furnance, better tools (stone) and get dirt (the easiest) or more wood to build a box house near a place with 1 single block of water.

After that, you only need to use your furnance with your log to get charcoal, with that charcoal you can "smelt" 8 more pieces of wood into more charcoal. 

There, you have now torches for your place and surroundings, a shelter, and enough materials to be safe inside.

Starving? No problem, with your tools get a hoe and punch out some seeds, they will grow in relatively quick time and there; food, tools, house, done.

 

In case of not being so good at rushing (or not willing to), you will be in problems the first night...dig a hole and you are safe.

 

After the next morning you will only die if you are not prepared enough or if you take too much risks...but the chance is really low if you have at least a slight idea of what you're doing.

 

I really don't like this part of Minecraft, I love this game and I've been playing since I discovered with friends years ago, we all played through the web, in a tiny window: Minecraft Classic (oh...the memories), and I've been playing since then.

I can't help to think there could be more, it could be better than how it is now; snapshot after snapshot things are getting way easier... and I really don't see it as a good survival mode anymore.

Giving you an example: I still remember when creepers used to "punch" you with their heads to death, and if you killed them, they exploded...that was way harder than now (as I recall, we couldn't even sprint back then).

 

So, I partially agree with Noah Meyer...Minecraft is too easy... I wouldn't go that far as "we need a harder mode"...I would just say "we need a real survival".
I plan to make my own suggestion about difficulty sometime soon.  Instead of peaceful, easy, normal, and hard, it will be peaceful, casual, difficult, hardcore, and starve.
I completely agree. With every update, Minecraft gets easier. They should add more mobs / a harder gamemode .

Also the villages they are WAY to easy to find I remember a few years back I was so excited finding a village as they were incredibly hard to find now you can find them in under like 10 minutes? 5? sure the villages look amazing compared to what they use to but they are way to easy to find and give you lots of loot that originally would take you a long time to obtain and it just takes a bit of fun out of the game
Just play hardcore ....

Mobs don't have enough.. or any.. variation in different ways required to kill them -- certainly not for a game headed to a decade old. Everything is a one step task. Nothing is skill oriented, but instead experience oriented. You're losing your older audience because of these concerns.

I do not understand at all.  Is this a biome?  Is it only a structure in the End?  What does it look like (other than dark)?  How would this be more exciting than fighting the Ender Dragon?

Yes it is indeed a biome only talking gameplay of it. What would be exciting is maybe a new boss could spawn here that could be stronger than that of the Ender Dragon. If you brighten an image of it up you will see that the ground is a purple color with trees that have a black log texture with pink leaves. Tall grass would also spawn here. And no it is not a structure. So that is my answer to your questions.
I feel like the Enderdragon should be the only boss for the End.  One boss per dimension.
@Bilbo Baggins Good point. I would want some unique mobs here and a mini boss rather than a full fledged boss.

Those scrambled words are scrambled for a reason, i have done some digging on the end poem, they are scrambled because... You fill in the blank's, like this one: It worked. with a million other's, to sculpt a true world in a fold of the [fill in the blank], and created a [fill in the blank] for [fill in the blank], in the [fill in the blank]

Let Me fill in the blank's: It worked, with a million other's, to sculpt a true world in a fold of the Yarn barn, and created a Big bucket for a giant Cow, in the Purple glass dome
Minecraft is Your adventure, Minecraft is a adventure for Everyone
I kinda think this ruins the poignancy (not a word) of the poem...

IF and thats a very big IF mojange were to add this they wouldnt be able to back port it to 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 1.5 1.6 1.7 1.8 1.9 1.10 1.11 1.12 or 1.13. Mojang can only add updates to the current releases. And whats with the / gamemode 4 {Random command syntax}

Same issue, Bedrock edition, multi monitor setup. Mouse will not stay on the app, I've tried in both windowed and full screen mode. My second monitor is to the right, so when I move right and try to mine or right click the game will go to the menu, meanwhile the mouse is over in the corner of the second screen.
I'm having the same issue and it is very frustrating! I've tried uninstalling and restarting my PC... Is this a bug? I don't know what to do.

im assuming this is a bug. ive heard many people are having this same issue and nothing fixes it, its just something that goes away on its own. hopefully minecraft does something about this soon. my java is perfectly fine at the moment. its just bedrock as far as i know.

Bedrock edition is genuinely trash. It constantly has bugs like this and never works properly, whether there's an update that it doesn't let you install, or the fact that it kicks you from a world if you alt tab (they just recently fixed this after like 8 years). The only benefit to playing bedrock over java is the fact that it is cross platform. Microsoft ruins everything they touch and have never done anything right for the consumer. Sorry for ranting it is just really frustrating.

Experiencing the same issue. Game is unplayable at this point with mouse consistently moving out of the game to the task bar or secondary monitor even in Full Screen mode. Happens with dual monitor or single monitor setup. Started happening after the last update

I am also having this issue. This is a particularly frustrating one because there doesn't seem to be any native workarounds. Going out of full screen mode and resizing the window may temporarily fix the issue but it seems to re-appear eventually.

While the following aren't as large of issues (seeing as this mouse issue makes the game unplayable,) it is also worth mentioning this entire update sucks:

- The loading screen takes its sweet time 'signing in' the xbox live profile, only for the main loading screen to also take time 'signing in' the xbox live profile. What is the point of doing this twice? I feel like I'm at the TSA and my driver's licence is being checked over and over again, a feeling that gets in the way of playing a game I paid for.

- The 'settings' and the 'marketplace' buttons getting swapped in the pause menu is a terrible idea obviously done to make people accidentally click the marketplace button when they're trying to modify the settings (particularly frustrating when I was trying to fix this mouse issue.)

- I've seen people post about a memory leak issue as well, though I haven't noticed this on my machine yet.

It is crazy Microsoft hasn't fixed the mouse issue over the last 6 days.

Same issue.  I have 3 monitors and tried creating a separation in the windows settings, but that's only a workaround and it creates a lot of other problems.  The only sure fire way to fix it was to clone all my displays.  I may attempt to install within a VM

Please fix this

Replying to my previous post (11/7 @ 9:30)  wanted to provide what I've found to be a "work around" 

Put game in windowed mode, make it slightly smaller than your screen edges (make sure it doesn't touch the taskbar either) and then attempt to play.  So far The mouse has not left the edge of the screen or hit the taskbar.  But there's a 1/8" - 1/4" gap around the game screen and my monitor's edges to make this even work.
okay, my minecraft had an update and the mouse issue is fixed, not sure if it fixed itself or if this new update fixed it.
There was a hotfix patch that addressed the issue on Monday I think.

Colored lights – Minecraft Feedback
I think during a blood moon more/only hostile mobs would spawn
During a Blue Moon no hostile mobs would spawn
During a Harvest Moon all plants would grow faster

As an eclipse would be a short event (even more so as Minecraft has 20 minute days/nights), I think that during that time hostile mobs should have a higher chance to spawn wearing a helmet, allowing them to survive once the sun quickly appears again
Trees could have rings that match the color of the event they went through, or maybe if they were grown in that period
Harvest Moons should be yellow, with possibly a little green tinge on the edges, like the moon is a potato
Boom game is a great idea for the world 3

A gamerule's been rejected over and over again. It doesn't fix the fact that combat isn't the same for neither servers, java nor bedrock. That's the main goal of these snapshots; find a system for intended play that works well for everyone.

Instead of a gamerule, you might have better luck asking to make everything about combat (like shields, regen, weapon attributes) customizable rather than hard-coded. That might fit a lot more Mojang's vision of the game.
Definitely a good idea, although, it should be more customizable instead of just a gamerule. Yes, the 1.9 update was really good, it's just the PvP that turned a lot of players away.
